params._mgv: The Mangrove instance to be arbitraged
params.admin: The admin of the contract. The only address allowed to withdraw funds.

params.params: The parameters needed to do the arbitrage
The parameters needed to do the arbitrage
params.token: The token needed to do the arbitrage

params.fee: The fee on the pool to do the initial and final exchange
params.params: The parameters needed to do the arbitrage
params.token: The token needed to do the arbitrage

returns._0: needsActivate The tokens that need to be approved

params.to: The address the amount should be transferred to.

returns.success: true if transfer was successful; otherwise, false.

params.to: The address the amount should be transferred to.

returns.success: true if transfer was successful; otherwise, false.

activateTokens(address[]).notice: This approves all the necessary tokens on Mangrove and the Uniswap router It is only the admin that can call this function

doArbitrage((uint256,address,uint256,add.notice: This tries to snipe the offer on Mangrove and sell what it got on Uniswap It reverts if it is not profitable It is only the arbitrager that can call this

doArbitrageExchangeOnMgv((uint256,addres.notice: This tries do an initial exchange from a token that the contract is holding, to the token needed for the arbitrage, via Mangrove Then tries to snipe the offer on Mangrove and sell what it got on Uniswap At last it exchanges back to the contracts own token, via Mangrove It reverts if it is not profitable It is only the arbitrager that can call this

doArbitrageExchangeOnUniswap((uint256,ad.notice: This tries do an initial exchange from a token that the contract is holding, to the token needed for the arbitrage, via Uniswap Then tries to snipe the offer on Mangrove and sell what it got on Uniswap At last it exchanges back to the contracts own token, via Uniswap It reverts if it is not profitable It is only the arbitrager that can call this

needsActivateTokens(address[]).notice: This checks if the contract has enough allowance on Mangrove and the Uniswap router

setAdmin(address).notice: This sets the admin. Only the current admin can change the admin.

withdrawNative(uint256,address).notice: This enables the admin to withdraw native tokens from the contract. Notice that only the admin can call this.

withdrawToken(address,uint256,address).notice: This enables the admin to withdraw tokens from the contract. Notice that only the admin can call this.
